content: lining up wrap nici griffin @beanieboatdesigns simple stitches striking lines… born from the long spaced-out queues of lockdown days the lining up wrap transforms a memory of distance into something warm comforting and deeply wearable worked in 4ply/fingering weight yarn with just 90g of each of two contrasting colours this wrap is rhythmic and relaxing to knit the very definition of netflix knitting only one colour is ever used at a time creating bold graphic lines with minimal fuss light drapey and versatile the lining up wrap is perfect for stash-busting those special skeins or pairing favourite contrasts notes are included for a dk version too whether you wear it as a wrap or a generously sized scarf it s destined to become a year-round favourite i apologise in advance of how many pages this pattern runs over i try to write my patterns so they are easy to line by line follow hopefully the simplicity of the instructions will make up for the number of pages i d love to see your finished wrap please share with me on instagram or facebook by tagging me @beanieboatdesigns and using the hashtag #liningupwrap follow me on instagram and facebook for updates on future patterns test-knits and giveaways from my little floating world yes i said floating … i live on a narrowboat ☺ if you need help or have any questions don t hesitate to contact me at nici@beanieboat com this pattern may not be altered reproduced or sold without my permission 1 notes yarn choice this wrap is suited to contrasting solid or tonal yarns or you will not get to see all the beauty of the lines dk version very simply put … use the same needles and work the pattern exactly as written you will use about 160g of each yarn in dk and get a nice thick winter wrap yarn needles and notions 4ply/fingering ~ 8 stitch markers 90g each of two colourways tapestry needle for sewing in those dreaded ends 4mm* 6 needles 80cm cable you are not knitting in the round but your cake not mandatory but always wrap will be too long to work appreciated comfortably on a straight needle gauge and size aggressive blocking is not essential for this wrap but you should end up with a finished garment size of approximately 30cm wide and 160cm long i m going to upset the purist and say that a gauge swatch is not essential this is a wrap not a fitted garment however if you re so inclined - using 4mm us 6 needles 27 stitches and 36 row 4 inch / 10 cm garter stitch worked flat abbreviations k knit rs right side of work k1bm knit to 1 stitch before marker s1b slip 1 with yarn in back k2bm knit to 2 stitches before marker s2b slip 2 with yarn in back k2tog knit two stitches together s1f slip 1 with yarn in front k3tog knit three stitches together s2f slip 2
